Instruction: Peel the potatoes and cut them into evenly sized chunks.
Place the potatoes in a large pot and cover them with water.
Add the salt to the pot and bring the water to a boil over high heat.
Reduce the heat to medium-low and let the potatoes simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until they are tender when pierced with a fork.
Drain the potatoes in a colander and return them to the pot.
Add the butter to the pot and begin mashing the potatoes.
Gradually add the milk while continuing to mash until the potatoes are smooth and creamy.
Season with additional salt and black pepper to taste.
